page.title: 20West Dean Estate
page.content: West Dean Estate is sited a few miles north of Chichester,and is owned by The Edward James Foundation,which also owns West Dean Gardens and West Dean College. The Estate covers 2500 ha of land,approx. one third of which is woodland,one third farmland,and one third is let out to tenants. Arable farming on the estate consists of wheat,barley,oats and maize,as well as small areas of kale and oil seed rape.The livestock on the estate includes 240 British Friesians and 850 breeding ewes. There is a wealth of wildlife on the estate,as well as the considerable amount of game animals which are kept. The West Dean Estate has been widely researched archaeologically,and many Stone Age,Roman and Medieval remains have been uncovered.
